/>
III.ii.2.E.2.d
.
JAG Office
Facts and circumstances of a court martial are kept at the respective Judge Advocate General (JAG) offices.  Court martials finalized on or after December 23, 2020, are available online.  The
Compensation Service Military Court Opinions
page directs users to the public databases maintained by each branch of service.
If the court martial documents are not available online, send a letter requesting the copies to the appropriate office and include in the request the former service member’s
full name
Department of Defense Identification/Electronic Data Interchange-Personal Identifier number
date of birth
dates of service, and
character of service (if known).
The table below lists the addresses and telephone numbers for the JAG offices of each service department.
Department of Service
Address
Telephone Number
Army
US Army Legal Services Agency (USALSA)
Office of the Clerk of Court/JALS-CCZ
9275 Gunston Road
Fort Belvoir, VA 22060-5546
(703) 693-1313
Note
:  Requests for court martial transcripts and proceedings for Army Veterans may also be faxed to the Clerk of Courts at (703) 806-0124.
Air Force/Space Force
AFLOA/JAJM
1500 West Perimeter Rd, Suite 1130
Joint Base Andrews, MD 20762
(240) 612-4820
Navy/Marine Corps
Department of the Navy
Criminal Law Division (Code 20)
1254 Charles Morris St. SE, Suite B-01
Washington Navy Yard, DC 20374-5124
E-mail
:
foiamiljus@navy.mil
(202) 685-6965
Notes
:
Do
not
use the Personnel Information Exchange System (PIES) to make this request.
For guidelines on requesting records if the individual was discharged from the National Guard, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, 2.B
.
title: M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section E - Service Record Address Codes and Addresses for Military Records Centers and Other Agencies
citation: Part III, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section E
